result.execSummary:
The defendant Harvey L. Kinney was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Armed Robbery with Threat of Force [Modifiers: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).
  • Armed Robbery with Use of Force [Modifiers: Conspiracy to Commit], a class C felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.32(2).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT: Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.
- Court sets restitution at $0 (zero).

with 175 days credit.
Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program - after seven (7) years of the initial confinement have been served.

superMiscConds.notes:
-  No Contact Order with Tomasena L., AND/OR Diana M.
-  No Contact Order with the co-actors:  Shairnee Carlson AND/OR  Darius Kinney AND/OR  Darrin Kinney AND/OR  Tristain Louis-Saffold AND/OR Justina Nunely.

-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy.
-  Take all medications as prescribed.
-  Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so).
- Cognitive thinking program.

-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment.
-  Absolute Sobriety.
-  Random screens.

supervisions.notes:
COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.
No weapons of any kind.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Harvey L. Kinney

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Original SENTENCING HEARING Transcript (47 pages) commencing JUNE 24, 2016, received and filed.  jm

Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in court with Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Sentencing proceeds.  As to the presentence investigation report - additional information provided as to page 15.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State, defense counsel and defendant. 

As to Count 5:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  10 years with 175 days credit -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  5 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  5 years.  

As to Count 7:
COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  9  years, consecutive to the sentence imposed as to Count 5  -  INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  4 years  -  EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  5 years.  

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program but IS eligible for the Substance Abuse Program - after seven (7) years of the initial confinement have been served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  Take all medications as prescribed
-  AODA assessment and comply with any recommended treatment
-  Absolute Sobriety
-  Random screens
-  Cognitive Thinking Program
-  No weapons of any kind
-  Court sets Restitution at $0 (zero)
-  No Contact Order with  Tomasena L.,   AND/OR   Diana M.
-  No Contact Order with the co-actors:  Shairnee Carlson   AND/OR  Darius Kinney   AND/OR  Darrin Kinney   AND/OR  Tristain Louis-Saffold    AND/OR   Justina Nunely
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis (if not already done so)
-  DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at the rate of 25% of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.  Written Explanation of Determinate Sentence, Pretrial Incarceration Credit and Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief received and filed.  Copies given to the defendant.
Clerk:  jms
letter from the defendant to the court as to sentencing - received and filed.
Electronic mailed copy to the State on June 22, 2016

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date.

  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 24, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Harvey L. Kinney not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Dept. of Corrections is requesting additional time to prepare the PSI report.
No objection by the parties as to adjournment.
Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Clerk:  jms

COURT ENTRY MADE WITHOUT CASE FILE IN COURT:
Court has been notified by the Dept. of Corrections that they are unable to complete the PSI by the sentencing date of May 13 and are requesting additional time to complete the PSI.
May 13 date to be changed to status conference; parties will choose a sentencing date at that time.
Clerk:  jms
Sentencing hearing scheduled for May 13, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in court with Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in custody.  David Robles and William Davidson, student intern practicing under the supervision of David Robles, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Count 5 and Coun 7:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  to both counts and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

As to Count 6:
Pursuant to plea negotiations and on motion of the State, Court orders Count  6  DISMISSED but read-in as to sentencing.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms and cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

PSI ordered.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 28.
Defendant remanded pending sentencing.  Jury trial is vacated.

Clerk:  jms

Court ordered defendant to be produced for the next court date if still in custody.

Case adjourned for plea hearing in Branch 28.  Case remains scheduled for jury trial until the next court date.

During the plea colloquy, Court declines to proceed with the plea and orders case adjourned for final pre-trial and jury trial in Branch 28.

Defendant Harvey L. Kinney not in court.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Dan Mitchell ill and unable to appear.  Matter rescheduled.  Plea hearing scheduled for January 7, 2016 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Harvey L. Kinney not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scheduling conference held between counsel.  Parties engaged in settlement negotiations .  Defense requests date for possible resolution of this matter.  Plea hearing scheduled for October 21, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Detective Michael Slomczewski Milwaukee Police Department.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 21.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 15, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Sworn:  Dr. Dawn Laurent via video.  Testimony taken.  Pursuant to Wisc. Stats. 971.14(4), Court finds defendant competent and reinstates proceedings.  Matter adjourned for a Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, Defendant Harvey L. Kinney not in court, in custody. David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court in trial. Also present in court video technician Michael Pook. Dr. Laurent will appear telephonically at the next hearing.  Competency hearing scheduled for August 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
From Dr. Dawn Laurent received and filed

Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant contests the findings of Dr. Laurent.  Telephone call made to Dr. Laurent to schedule a contested hearing.  Dr. Laurent to appear via video.   Hearing date scheduled with Dr. Laurent, State and Defense.  Video technician notified of date.  Hearing scheduled for July 16, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Received and filed.

Attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell in court, defendant Harvey L. Kinney not in court, in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case set for return on doctor's report. Doctor's report reviewed by the parties.  The examining doctor could not come to a conclusion.  Court ordered defendant remanded to a state insitution for examination.  Doctor's Report Return scheduled for June 12, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Report dated 5-14-15 authored by John Pankiewicz, received and filed.

Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in court with attorney Daniel Gordon Mitchell.  Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in custody.  David Robles appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court is advised by the defense there is reason to believe the defendant is not competent to proceed.  Pursuant to Sec. 971.14 (2) Wisconsin Statutes, Court found probable cause and ordered defendant examined by the Forensic Unit.  Order for Examination, signed and filed.   Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Brash, Branch 21.   Court ordered defendant REMANDED into custody of Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.
    No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with MICHAEL T., JAMIE S., JOE M. & MALLET FOODS, TARA ANN P., FRANK L., BURNETTA J., TOMESENA L., DIANA M., MYRA D. AND JERALD D.
CO-ACTORS:  SHAIRNEE CARLSON, DARRIN KINNEY, DARIUS KINNEY, TRISTAIN LOUIS-SAFFOLD AND JUSTINE NUNELY; ALSO KEEP SEPARATE WHILE IN CUSTODY.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in court with attorney Mary Garvin Guimont.  Defendant Harvey L. Kinney in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge BRASH, Branch 21.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.

  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he/she may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he/she meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).

  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 6, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
